description: The default colour palette for all FT products. The palette supports colour contrast checking, colour mixing and toneing.
keywords: o-colours, colours, themes, schemes, pink, salmon, slate, tone, mix, background, palette

demos.name: master-primary-palette
demos.title: Primary Palette
demos.description: Color is a fundamental attribute of the FT visual language. Consistent use of the primary palette across the platform strengthens our brand by evoking familiarity and trust.

demos.name: master-secondary-palette
demos.title: Secondary Palette
demos.description: Secondary colors provide visual hierarchy to differentiate content and are brand identifiers of the FT.

demos.name: master-tertiary-palette
demos.title: Tertiary Palette
demos.description: Used sparingly, these colors provide contrast for highlighting and messaging.

demos.name: master-b2c-palette
demos.title: B2C Palette
demos.description: These colors are specifically designed for use in B2C products.

demos.name: master-brand-palette
demos.title: Brand Palette
demos.description: These colours are specifically designed for use in some digital assets, such as the FT logo. For example, brand-ft-pink could be used to prevent a flash of the wrong colours as the logo loads

demos.name: master-tones
demos.title: Tones and Mixes
demos.description: Tones (colours with modified brightness using the HSB colour space) can be used to produce a broad spectrum of lighter and darker variations of palette colours for creating scale and depth to your designs. To reduce our number of colour combinations not all colours may be toned, but mixes of black/white may be used instead.
